question.hint: Type the reference number. It will be determined by the study team.
question.title: Reference number

question.hint: Type the address of the POS.
question.title: Address

question.hint: Mark polygon on Location tab. The area of the POS will be automatically calculated.
question.title: Area in hectares (mark polygon on Location tab)

question.hint: Type the POSTCODE of the POS.
question.title: Postcode

question.hint: Automatically generated after drawing polygon.
question.title: Geocode (mark polygon on Location tab)

question.hint: Type the year of establishment of POS.
question.title: Year of Establishment of POS

question.hint: Consider the type of activities that the POS was designed for. Active-Formal if the POS has facilities used for organized, formal sports (e.g. goal posts, soccer net, cricket pitch, scoreboards). Active Informal if the POS has facilities designed for unstructured, informal physical activity (e.g. walking paths, children's playground, or basketball hoops). Passive if the POS has no facilities designed for physical activity (e.g.the POS has seating only provided).
question.title: Type of usage (tick all relevant)

question.hint: Check to see what courts and/or goal posts are present in the POS, and tick the relevant sports on the list. Also check signs within the POS and on clubrooms for lists of sports played there, and clubs that are affiliated with the POS. Tick 'Other' if the type of activity is not included in the list. Please write in the space provided what this activity is.
question.title: For what type of activities the space is designed? (tick all relevant)

question.hint: If the boundary of the park adjoins the river or beach foreshore, then tick YES. If there is a road, railway line, or other barrier between the POS and the river/beach foreshore, tick NO.
question.title: Is the POS on the beach/river foreshore?

question.hint: Water features are things such as lakes, ponds, fountains, and streams. Tick YES if any or all of these features are present. Also tick YES if the structure of a water feature is there, but is presently without water.
question.title: Are there water features in the POS?

question.hint: A lake is a body of water (salt or fresh water) of considerable size, surrounded by land. A pond is a smaller, artificial water feature. A water fountain is a jet or stream of water made by mechanical means. A stream is a body of flowing water.
question.title: Type of water feature (tick all relevant)
Estimate the percentage of the POS occupied by the water feature(s) (tick one)
Are there other aesthetic features in the POS?
Which of the following features are present? (tick all relevant)
Are there trees in the POS?
Estimate the approximate number of trees present (tick one)

question.hint: Perimeter all sides when trees are located along all sides of the POS. Perimeter some sides when trees are placed in a row along at least one side, but not along all sides of the POS. Along walking paths when trees are placed in a row along walking paths through or around the perimeter of the POS. Random placement throughout when the placement of trees in the POS appears 'natural', or without any apparent pattern, or with a pattern, but spread throughout the POS.
question.title: Where are the trees placed? (tick all relevant)

question.hint: A garden is any space with numerous plants (flowers, shrubs or trees) planted in a garden bed and defined with a border.
question.title: Are there gardens in this POS?

question.hint: Paths are cleared tracks with hard surfaces that can be used for walking or cycling. The surface of a path may vary to include stone, concrete, dirt or gravel. Only tick 'designated dual-use path/s' if signage or markings on the path indicate that cycling is permitted.
question.title: Are the walking paths or cycleways within or around the POS? (tick all relevant)
Shade along paths (tick one)

option.title: Very good (canopies of many trees touch)
Medium (canopies don't touch but trees close together)
Poor (canopies of trees don't touch and trees spread apart)

question.hint: Tick all relevant options. Perimeter along all sides when the paths inside the POS are located along all sides of the POS. Perimeter on some sides when paths are placed on at least one side, but not on all sides of the POS. Diagonally when paths are placed across the POS. Radially when paths radiate from the center of the POS. The paths within the POS are placed around the water/visual resource
question.title: Describe the placement of paths within the POS (tick all relevant)

question.hint: Tick YES if the grass is green and well tended. In winter, check to see if there are reticulation pumps or pipes, or sprinklers evident. If not, tick NO.
question.title: Is there evidence that the grass is watered?

question.hint: Check the municipality website at the beginning of the audit for rules relating to dogs in the POS (this information will be highlighted in the printed Municipality webpages supplied to you at the beginning of the audit). If the municipal website only lists prohibited dog areas, then assume dogs are allowed in all other publically accessible open spaces.
question.title: Are dogs allowed? (tick all relevant)

option.title: Yes, on leash at all times
Yes, on leash at certain times

question.title: Is access for dogs: (tick one)

question.hint: Check the following areas carefully for evidence of graffiti: play equipment (including the underside of slides and cubby houses); rubbish bins; BBQ's, tables, seats; buildings (ensure that you walk right around to check the rear doors and walls).
question.title: Is graffiti present?

question.hint: Carefully check all natural and built features for signs of deliberate damage (e.g.: broken windows, broken glass).
question.title: Is vandalism evident?
Is there litter throughout the POS?

question.hint: Tick YES if equipment is located within the POS. Tick YES if play equipment is located on school grounds adjacent to the POS, provided that the grounds are clearly accessible to the public, and able to be reached without crossing a road or other barrier.
question.title: Is children's play equipment present?
What items of play equipment are present? (tick all relevant)
What is the playground surface? (tick all relevant)

question.hint: Fill up this information for all playgound areas available in the POS.
question.title: Is playground shaded? (tick one only)

question.hint: Check to see if there is gas, electric or wood barbecues within the POS. Particularly check around areas with seating.
question.title: Are barbecues present?

question.hint: Picnic tables must include a table and cannot be seating alone. Check around barbecues areas.
question.title: Are picnic tables present?

question.hint: Take care to check all sides of the POS. Tick YES (and count) if there are marked parking bays adjacent to/alongside park (or clearly identified as serving the POS). Do not include POS verges as parking facilities, unless signs or markings indicate the space is to be used for POS parking.
question.title: Are the parking facilities serving the POS?
Estimate the number of bays
Are there public access toilets?

question.hint: Tick one only. Check to see if there is a permanent structure (building) within the POS that sells food. Do not include kiosks or cafés on the streets around the POS. Do not include vans or mobile food outlets. Do not include kiosks associated with local clubrooms that are only open for local weekend sporting matches.
question.title: Is there a kiosk/café present? (tick one only)

question.hint: Tick YES if bus, train, or ferry stops are located no further than 1 block away from the POS.
question.title: Is there access to public transport within one block of POS?

question.hint: This question refers to seating within the park. Do not include seating at public transport stops and the picnic tables.
question.title: Is there seating present?
Are there clubrooms/meeting rooms present?

question.hint: Do not include rubbish bins of the street.
question.title: Are rubbish bins present?

question.hint: Tally up the number of litter bag locations you see as you walk around the POS
question.title: Are dog litter bags provided?

question.hint: Record the total number of locations for bags
question.title: In how many locations in the POS are dog litter bags present?

question.hint: Take care to check around playground areas, buildings such as club rooms and toilets, and near the perimeter of POS. Do not include drinking fountains intended for human use.
question.title: Are there taps or other water sources accessible for dogs?

question.hint: Take care to check around playground areas, buildings, and near perimeter of POS.
question.title: Are drinking fountains present?

question.hint: This question relates to lighting specific to the POS. It does not include normal street lighting.
question.title: Is there lighting within the POS? (i.e., not just street lighting)

question.hint: Around courts, buildings and equipment if lighting is located next to these features. Along paths if lighting is placed in a row along paths through or around the perimeter of the POS. Perimeter all sides if lighting is located along all sides of the POS. Perimeter some sides when lighting is placed in a row along at least one side, but not all sides of the POS. Random throughout POS when the placement of lighting in the POS appears without any apparent pattern, or with a pattern but spread throughout the POS.
question.title: Where is the lighting located? (tick all relevant)

question.hint: Stand in the centre of the POS and survey the roads that border the POS. Clearly visible means that there are no trees, buildings, parked cars, or buildings between the POS and the road.
question.title: From the centre of the POS, how visible are surrounding roads? (tick one)

option.title: Road/s clearly visible from the centre of the POS
Road/s partly visible from the centre of the POS
Road/s cannot be seen from the centre of the POS

question.title: From the centre of the POS, how visible are the surrounding houses? Clear visibility means you can clearly see windows, back, yards, or front yards of houses overlooking the park. (tick one)

option.title: House/s clearly visible from the centre of the POS
House/s partly visible from the centre of the POS
House/s cannot be seen from the centre of the POS (go to Q47)

question.title: How many of these houses overlook the park? (tick one)

question.hint: Tick YES if there are areas of the POS where your visibility of surrounding houses is obscured in any way.
question.title: Is there any area of the POS where you are unable to clearly see surrounding houses?

question.hint: Cul-de-sacs include 'no through roads' or terminating roads. Minor local roads allow only 1 lane of traffic in each direction. Major local roads allow 2 lanes of traffic in each direction.
question.title: Are all roads surrounding the POS minor roads or cul-de-sacs?

question.hint: Tick YES if a zebra crossing is visible from the POS entrance nearest the major road.
question.title: Does the major roads/s have a zebra crossing to assist access to the POS?

question.hint: Tick YES if a crossing with signals is visible from the POS entrance nearest the major road.
question.title: Does the major roads/s have a pedestrian crossing with signals to assist access to the POS?
To what extent do you agree or disagree with each of the following statements regarding this POS? POS is interesting for walking? (choose one number fo each item)

question.hint: Consider the following in determining how suitable the POS is for Ball sports: is there sufficient open space? is the ground level? are there any apparent hazards to the participants or surrounding features (e.g. garden beds, steep slopes)?
question.title: To what extent do you agree or disagree with each of the following statements regarding this POS? POS is suitable for casual ball sports? (choose one number fo each item)
To what extent do you agree or disagree with each of the following statements regarding this POS? POS is suitable for cycling? (choose one number fo each item)
